name: Calls
description: Integrates real-time voice communication in Mattermost

settings_schema.header: Calls plugin enables voice calls with screensharing in channels. See [documentation](https://docs.mattermost.com/channels/make-calls.html) to learn more.

settings.help_text: When test mode is enabled, only system admins are able to start calls in channels. This allows testing to confirm calls are working as expected.
The local IP address used by the RTC server to listen on for UDP connections.
The local IP address used by the RTC server to listen on for TCP connections.
The UDP port the RTC server will listen on.
The TCP port the RTC server will listen on.
(Optional) The IP (or hostname) to be used as the host ICE candidate. If empty, it defaults to resolving via STUN.

(Optional) A port number to be used as an override for host candidates in place of the one used to listen on.
Note: this port will apply to both UDP and TCP host candidates
(Optional) The URL to a running RTCD service instance that should host the calls. When set (non empty) all calls will be handled by the external service.
The maximum number of participants that can join a call. If left empty, or set to 0, it means unlimited.
(Optional) A list of ICE servers (STUN/TURN) configurations to use. This field should contain a valid JSON array.
(Optional) The secret key used to generate TURN short-lived authentication credentials.
(Optional) The number of minutes that the generated TURN credentials will be valid for.
(Optional) When set to on it will pass and use configured TURN candidates to server initiated connections.
When set to true it allows call participants to share their screen.
When set to true it enables simulcast for screen sharing. This can help to improve screen sharing quality.
(Optional) When set to true, call recordings are enabled.
The URL to a running calls job service instance used for call recordings.
The maximum duration (in minutes) for call recordings. Value must be in the range [15, 180].

The audio and video quality of call recordings.
 Note: this setting can affect the overall performance of the job service and the number of concurrent recording jobs that can be run.
(Optional) When set to true, post-call transcriptions are enabled.
The speech-to-text API to use for post-call transcriptions.
The speech-to-text model size to use for post-call transcriptions. Heavier models will produce more accurate results at the expense of processing time and resources usage.
The API key for Azure Speech Services
The API region for Azure Speech Services
The number of threads used by the post-call transcriber. This must be in the range [1, numCPUs].
(Optional) When set to true, live captions are enabled.
The speech-to-text model size to use for live captions. Heavier models will produce more accurate results at the expense of processing time and resources usage.

settings.display_name: Live captions: Number of transcribers used per call
settings.help_text: The number of separate live-captions transcribers for each call. Each transcribes one audio stream at a time. The product of LiveCaptionsNumTranscribers * LiveCaptionsNumThreadsPerTranscriber must be in the range [1, numCPUs].

settings.display_name: Live captions: Number of threads per transcriber
settings.help_text: The number of threads per live-captions transcriber. The product of LiveCaptionsNumTranscribers * LiveCaptionsNumThreadsPerTranscriber must be in the range [1, numCPUs].
The language passed to the live captions transcriber. Should be a 2-letter ISO 639 Set 1 language code, e.g. 'en'. If blank, will be set to English 'en' as default.
When set to true the RTC service will work in dual-stack mode, listening for IPv6 connections and generating candidates in addition to IPv4 ones.

When set to true, ringing functionality is enabled: participants in DM and GM channels will receive a desktop alert and a ringing notification when a call is started. Changing this setting requires a plugin restart.
